1.name: The Personal History, Adventures, Experience, & Observation of David Copperfield the Younger
1.description: A gentle orphan discovers life and love in an indifferent adult world.

2.name: A Tale of Two Cities
2.description: A pair of lookalikes, one a former French aristocrat and the other an alcoholic English lawyer, fall in love with the same woman amongst the turmoil of the French Revolution.

3.name: Bride of Frankenstein
3.description: Mary Shelley reveals the main characters of her novel survived: Dr. Frankenstein, goaded by an even madder scientist, builds his monster a mate.

4.name: Call of the Wild
4.description: During the Klondike Gold Rush, a traveler purchases a dog to lead the way toward the treasure, but reconsiders his journey when he finds a jilted married woman.

5.name: The 39 Steps
5.description: A man in London tries to help a counter-espionage Agent. But when the Agent is killed, and the man stands accused, he must go on the run to save himself and stop a spy ring which is trying to steal top secret information.

6.name: The Dawn Rider
6.description: After seeing his father gunned down, a young man vows to bring the desperados to justice.

7.name: Mutiny on the Bounty
7.description: A tyrannical ship captain decides to exact revenge on his abused crew after they form a mutiny against him, but the sailor he targets had no hand in it.

8.name: The Desert Trail
8.description: Rodeo star John Scott and his gambler friend Kansas Charlie are wrongly accused of armed robbery. They leave town as fast as they can to go looking for their own suspects in Poker City.

9.name: Top Hat
9.description: An American dancer comes to Britain and falls for a model whom he initially annoyed, but she mistakes him for his goofy producer.

10.name: A Midsummer Night's Dream
10.description: Theseus, Duke of Athens, is going to marry Hyppolyta, Queen of the Amazons. Demetrius is engaged with Hermia, but Hermia loves Lysander. Helena loves Demetrius. Oberon and Titania, of the ...                See full summary »

11.name: The Lives of a Bengal Lancer
11.description: Three British soldiers on the Northwest Frontier of India struggle against the enemy - and themselves.

12.name: Captain Blood
12.description: After being wrongly convicted as a traitor, Peter Blood, an English physician, is sent to exile in the British colonies of the Caribbean, where he becomes a pirate.

13.name: Paradise Canyon
13.description: An undercover agent for the government is sent to round up a gang of counterfeiters operating near the Mexican border.

14.name: A Night at the Opera
14.description: A sly business manager and two wacky friends of two opera singers help them achieve success while humiliating their stuffy and snobbish enemies.

15.name: Broadway Melody of 1936
15.description: Bob Gordon is staging a new Broadway Show. He gets an offer of money by Lillian, if she can dance in his show. Gordon's old class mate Irene, tries to get the leading role in this show, but Lillian insists in getting this part herself.

16.name: She
16.description: Leo Vincey, told by his dying uncle of a lost land visited 500 years ago by his ancestor, heads out with family friend Horace Holly to try to discover the land and its secret of immortality...                See full summary »

17.name: Curly Top
17.description: Wealthy Edward Morgan becomes charmed with a curly-haired orphan and her pretty older sister Mary and arranges to adopt both under the alias of "Mr. Jones." As he spends more time with them, he soon finds himself falling in love with Mary.

18.name: The Informer
18.description: In 1922, an Irish rebel informs on his friend, then feels doom closing in.

19.name: Sylvia Scarlett
19.description: When her father decides to flee to England, young Sylvia Scarlett must become Sylvester Scarlett and protect her father every step of the way, with the questionable help of plenty others.

20.name: Anna Karenina
20.description: The married Anna Karenina falls in love with Count Vronsky despite her husband's refusal to grant a divorce, and both must contend with the social repercussions.

21.name: Crime and Punishment
21.description: Man is haunted by a murder he's committed.

22.name: Magnificent Obsession
22.description: The life of spoiled rich Robert Merrick is saved through the use of a hospital's only resuscitator, but because the medical device cannot be in two places at once, it results in the death ...                See full summary »

23.name: The Last Days of Pompeii
23.description: In the doomed Roman city, a gentle blacksmith becomes a corrupt gladiator, while his son leans toward Christianity.

24.name: Turn of the Tide
24.description: The arrival in a Yorkshire fishing village of the Lunns with a modern fishing boat is deeply resented by the Fosdykes. Eventually hostilities are overcome and the families join forces to get a modern deep sea fishing boat.

25.name: Becky Sharp
25.description: Set against the background of the Battle of Waterloo, Becky Sharp is the story of Vanity Fair by Thackeray. Becky and Amelia are girls at school together, but Becky is from a "show biz" ...                See full summary »

26.name: Les Misérables
26.description: In early 19th Century France an ex-convict who failed to report to parole is relentlessly pursued over a 20 year period by an obsessive policeman.

27.name: Dante's Inferno
27.description: Jim Carter moves in on the McWade's carnival concession which shows scenes from Dante's "Inferno". He makes it a going concern, marrying Betty along the way. An inspector calls the ...                See full summary »

28.name: The Ace of Spades
28.description: The wife of a candidate for Parliament is having an affair with the brother of her husband's rival. The rival candidate, Trent, is running for election on a promise of building a railway ...                See full summary »

29.name: Dangerous
29.description: An alcoholic actress who is considered a dangerous jinx is rehabilitated, but she then shows that she's as dangerous as ever.

30.name: The Little Colonel
30.description: After Southern belle Elizabeth Lloyd runs off to marry Yankee Jack Sherman, her father, a former Confederate colonel during the Civil War, vows to never speak to her again. Several years ...                See full summary »

31.name: Mark of the Vampire
31.description: When a nobleman is murdered, a professor of the occult blames vampires; but not all is what it seems.

32.name: Rainbow Valley
32.description: John Martin is a government agent working under cover. Leading citizen Morgan calls in gunman Galt who blows Martin's cover.

33.name: Werewolf of London
33.description: The juice of a rare Tibetan flower is the only thing that keeps Dr. Glendon from turning into a werewolf during a full moon.

34.name: Mad Love
34.description: In France, an insane surgeon's obsession with an actress from England leads him to replace her pianist husband's hands that got mangled in an accident with the hands of a late knife murderer which still have the urge to throw knives.

35.name: The Raven
35.description: A brilliant surgeon obsessed with Edgar Allan Poe saves the life of a beautiful dancer and goes mad when he can't have her.

36.name: Alice Adams
36.description: The misadventures of two social-climbing women in small town America.

37.name: The Dark Angel
37.description: The close relationship between a woman and her two male childhood friends is tested when she accepts a marriage proposal from one of them, while the burgeoning First World War threatens to change their lives forever.

38.name: The Good Fairy
38.description: A naive girl just out of a cloistered orphanage finds that being a 'good fairy' to strangers makes life awfully complicated.

39.name: Bordertown
39.description: In Mexico, a former lawyer becomes the invaluable second-in-command to a casino owner, whose wife begins to fall for him.

40.name: Hop-a-Long Cassidy
40.description: An evil ranch foreman tries to provoke a range war by playing two cattlemen against each other while helping a gang to rustle the cattle. Each cattleman blames the other for missing cattle....                See full summary »

41.name: Ruggles of Red Gap
41.description: An English valet brought to the American west assimilates into the American way of life.

42.name: 'G' Men
42.description: It's the early days of the F.B.I. - federal agents working for the Department of Justice. Though they've got limited powers - they don't carry weapons and have to get local police approval ...                See full summary »

43.name: The Whole Town's Talking
43.description: A meek milquetoast of a clerk is mistaken for Public Enemy #1, and the notorious killer takes advantage of the situation.

44.name: Gold Diggers of 1935
44.description: Romantic antics abound among the guests at a luxury hotel, including a stage director, an eccentric millionaire, and the daughter of a financial backer.

45.name: China Seas
45.description: When earthy Dolly Portland is rejected by Captain Gaskell in favor of a socialite, she aids Jamesy McCardle, in league with Malay pirates, in his plot to seize his ship.

46.name: Roberta
46.description: In Paris, a man clueless about fashion suddenly inherits his aunt's dress shop, while his bandleader friend reunites with his old flame.

47.name: Naughty Marietta
47.description: In order to avoid a prearranged marriage, a rebellious French princess sheds her identity and escapes to colonial New Orleans, where she finds an unlikely true love.

48.name: Charlie Chan in Egypt
48.description: While investigating the theft of antiquities from an ancient tomb excavation, Charlie discovers that the body of the expedition's leader concealed inside the mummy's wrappings.

49.name: The Crusades
49.description: King Richard and the Third Crusade (1190-1192) are given the DeMille treatment with more spectacle than history.

50.name: Suicide Squad
50.description: Larry Baker is a young fireman whose daring exploits have led him to receiving a lot of newspaper publicity which goes to his head. His sweetheart, Mary O'Connor, and fire-department ...                See full summary »
